item.title: Report E-2023090052
item.description:
Report E-2023090052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: SEEKONK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 23, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN3267 was damaged due to a faulty skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Boston Green Company BCG to remediate the impacted site. BCG personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the corrosive-liquid impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. Crews also used hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet. BCG personnel proceeded to use a Hudson sprayer to wash down the trailer and pavement and deployed another layer of absorbents to ensure no product or product-rinseate remained at the site. All spent absorbents, the cut-up pallet, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums.

item.title: Report E-2023090051
item.description:
Report E-2023090051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3260 was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free standing product from the trailer floor The crew then utilized degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3260-impacted material was collected and containerized in one 91) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090050
item.description:
Report E-2023090050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, fifteen (15) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in using hand tools. The crew then removed all impacted cardboard and plywood debris from the trailer. All clean up material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The fifteen (15) damaged one-gallon pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Borth drums were left onsite for further evaluation.

item.title: Report E-2023090049
item.description:
Report E-2023090049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1188 was mishandled by terminal personnel and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect the released product, then transferred the remaining product into one (1) new 55-gallon drum for further shipping. Utilizing hand tools, all UN1188 impacted material was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090048
item.description:

  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and utilized hand tools to collect all printer ink-impacted materials and the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.description:
Report E-2023081000

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1903 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from 3R Incorporated (3R) to remediate the impacted site. Crews patched and collected the damaged 55-gallon drum and placed it in a 95-gallon over-pack drum for disposal. Crews utilized a pump up sprayer and absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the concrete floor. All quaternary ammonia compound impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and were added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080998

  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1193 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed absorbents and degreaser to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. SET personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into a 95-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1915 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All UN1915-impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-tablespoon of product released to the tote body due to the tote cap not being sealed correctly. The crew re-secured the tote and preformed a slosh test to ensure no further release would occur in transit. The tote was wiped down and all impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon metal pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 11, 2023, at 1018 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Rock Hill, South Carolina regarding the release of approximately (10) gallons of H834-RAA-30 (Resin Solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a punctured drum during load shift. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, they confirmed that the release was contained to wooden pallets and the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, and (3) 95-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

GES personnel overpacked the two (2) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. item.title: Report X-2023081722
item.description:
Report X-2023081722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY A SORTER ON THE SLIDE OF THE HUB SECONDARY THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMIDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES, DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND TRANSPORDED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FUTHER ISNPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP 3/4 TURN, AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 95 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA

  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE IRREGS BELT FOR A LEAKER. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS THE RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE SEAL ON THE METAL 5 GALLON BUCKET LID WAS THE MAIN POINT OF THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER STARTED THE PROCESSING.

  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed during transit and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the adjacent plywood. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. E3 personnel collected the damaged pail, then deployed absorbent pads to collect the released product. The crew then containerized all paint impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: On August 16, 2023, two (2) 2.5-gallon jugs of sodium hydroxide were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel removed the damaged containers and wiped the area with absorbent pads. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: On August 21, 2023 at 2141 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contracted by Landstar personnel in Meridian, Mississippi regarding the release of approximately (20) gallons of AFCO 4363 Persafe 23 UN3109, 5.2, II) from (1) 330-gallon IBC plastic tote. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to an area on the trailer and a 1x20 area on surrounding concrete The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080724
item.description:
Report E-2023080724

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading an outbound trailer of totes at Veolia's 10-day facility in Port Allen, LA a forklift punctured the IBC. The forks of the lift were extending approximately 3-4 inches beyond the underneath of the IBC and while repositioning the tote the fork made contact with another tote behind it, resulting in a ~3" gash at the bottom corner of the container. The tote began leaking rapidly and spilled ~150 gallons within a 10 minute span. The material flooded the back of the box van and the surrounding concrete of the dock area. The Veolia team quickly began blocking off the storm drain located in the dock area with spill pads and oil dry, as well as blocking off the back of the trailer to slow the pace of the material leaking out the trailer. The spill was promptly cleaned up and absorbent material was containerized. The remaining material in the damaged tote was transferred into a new container.

item.title: Report E-2023080706
item.description:
Report E-2023080706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPW experienced a UN3266 Temp Det release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 10 x 30 area of the trailer floor and adjacent freight due to being crushed by other freight. The damaged pail was placed into a 15-gallon poly drum. Three 15-gallon poly drums of UN2984 hydrogen peroxide MicroTech Liquid Oxygen Bleach were impacted by the product and stained, each was placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. A baking soda solution was then utilized to neutralize all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into to collect all product and neutralizer. The impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and rags were collected and containerized into a supersack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080696
item.description:
Report E-2023080696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, at 0239 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN3149 AcidiShine to the trailer floor and asphalt lot below from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. On August 18, 2023, at 0530 ET, contractors arrived onsite. Crew confirmed one 55-gallon poly drum of UN3149 AcidiShine released due to a pallet nail puncture. Approximately 30-gallons released to a 5 x 30 area of the trailer floor and a 10 x 5 area of the asphalt lot below. The impacted surfaces and debris were neutralized with a vinegar solution and confirmed neutral with pH test strips. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon vented poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On August 8, 2023, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN2735 were crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the spill and worked them in using hand tools. After utilizing a degreasing solution and absorbent pads, all waste was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

  • Description: On August 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3265 was damaged due to an unsecure bung and released approximately half of one (.5) gallon of product to the drum and trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel resecured the bung and deployed neutralizer to the release. The crew then used absorbent pads to collect all loose product. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023080681
item.description:
Report E-2023080681

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the concrete dock floor and an 8ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released. First Call Environmental personnel removed 29 boxes that contained two (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs that were impacted by the released material. The non-damaged boxes (a total 67 boxes) were restacked and shipped onto the consignee. First Call Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted areas and First Call Environmental personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard and plastic jugs were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023080645

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: WESTMINSTER
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLL experienced a release of UN1760 NAG-75 from (4) 5-gallon poly pails and non-regulated iShine from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of each product, 10 gallons total, released as a result of improper loading. The release impacted a 6 x 6 area of the trailer floor and an 8 x 12 area of the concrete lot below. Oil dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbent waste was then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All damaged pails of NAD-75 were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged pails of non-regulated iShine containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced aUN1090 Klean Strip Acetone release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of Acetone released impacting the cardboard packaging only due to being crushed by other freight. Four damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Four impacted and damaged but not leaking containers of Jasco Premium Paint & Epoxy Remover were also containerized into a 30-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard was collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 4, 2023 ,one (1) 1-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide was mishandled by an operator and released approximately one (1) gallon to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed neutralizing absorbents to the sodium hydroxide-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews utilized hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet, and then proceeded to place the undamaged freight on another pallet. All spent absorbents, the empty container, the cut-up pallet, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: On August 4, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1814 were crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel overpacked the damaged drums in one (1) 55-gallon drum, then dismantled the impacted pallet. The crew used absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted surfaces and contained all clean up material in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed that the drum was not damaged and the release only impacted the top of the drum and was dried up. EWI personnel tightened the bungs on the drum and demobilized.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LLR experienced a customer location release of UN1760 SNB-130 from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 1' x 15' area of the trailer floor. The tote was punctured by a loading strap, resulting in the release. The crew transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new one. Citric acid solution was then deployed to neutralize the impacted area and then collected with absorbents. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged hauled to the XPO terminal in Little Rock, AR and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN3267 Sikadur 52 Part B release from (3) 1-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to an 8' x 2' area of the trailer floor and an 8' x 8' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. The crew advised the lids of the pails were crushed due to improper loading causing the release. Oil Gator was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. Once complete, the areas were pH strip tested to confirm neutralization. All waste was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080559
item.description:
Report E-2023080559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: SHREWSBURY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWO experienced a release from a 2950-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of battery acid released impacting multiple areas of concrete to include a 10' x 10' and 20' x 10' areas, a 40' x 1' area of the ramp and a 5' x 5' area where the battery was sitting. The battery tipped over in transit causing 6 of the caps to be lost, resulting in a release. Terminal personnel removed the battery from the trailer to a dock area, which resulted in acid being released to multiple areas. The crew worked the absorbents deployed by XPO into the impacted areas and collected them into drums. The areas were then neutralized with sodium bicarb. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged battery was up righted and secured to a new pallet, with poly sheeting taped over it to prevent further release. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Cargo Tank was was in a construction zone. Shoulder was reduced to 2.5 feet. Left side of vehicle left the pavement and in the drivers attempt of return to the paved surface the trailer "tripped" initiating the a 3/4 rollover. The tractor and cargo tank came to rest on its drivers side. The leakage was from the normal vent for compartment #1. The leakage continue until compartment #1's contents were transloaded during the recovery (approximately 3 hours). The total leakage was 30 gallons which was contained. All contaminated soil was removed and DNR testing has been conducted and submitted.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LANSING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The outer pkg contained 4 plastic jugs of chemical drain cleaner. The jugs had screw-on caps. At some point during the pkg's shipment the vibration of transit caused the jugs' screw-on caps to loosen. 3 of the jugs' caps were only slightly loose while the 4th jug's cap was found completely off the jug. Chemical odor and pkg dampness prompted inspection at the delivery station. The pkg was placed in a plastic tub when first discovered and was sent to the station's QA area for eventual inspection and processing. DescribePack: Again, vessels that employ screw-on caps are prone to having the caps loosen from the vibration of transit alone. 3 of the 4 jugs' caps were found to be slightly loose - the 4th jug's cap was completely off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps on the jugs were tightened, the jugs were wiped down with paper towels, and contaminated cardboard was contained in a plastic tub.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 0713. At 0819 package was work area scanned. At approximately 0825 QA was called to belt 1 to inspect a possibly damaged package. Upon arrival to the area package was identified as a HazMat and 1 of the 4 items in the package was found to have a loose/damaged lid that allowed some of its contents to spill out. Package was taken to QA1. After which it was placed in a salvage drum and secured to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Package appears whole and intact except for a 5 inch x 1 inch almost rectangular shaped wet mark. On the inside of the package there is approximately a 8 inch x 4 inch wet glossy mark with paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damage and the package was identified as a HazMat; it was taken from the loading area and secured safely away from other packages and persons to reduce and potential of damage or harm to anyone or anything.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 08/01/2023, at 10:52 hours, A FRA inspector in the CSXT Manville yard discovered the SHPX222886, a residue tank car of Waste Flammable Liquid, having a vapor release from the top of the car. The rail car was isolated and the shipper, GEOCYCLE, was notified via the waybills emergency contact number (877-818-0087). MEI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car was releasing product vapor due to a faulty vacuum relief valve (VRV). Contractor personnel removed the faulty VRV and installed a pipe plug to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Marvin Sparks (843-826-1746, marvin.sparks@geocycle.com). The car was held at this location pending further repair and qualification by a certified mobile repair unit or receipt of One Time Move Approval from the FRA.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 22nd, 2023, SkyWest flight UA4691 was traveling from Oklahoma City to Houston. While on final approach passenger Ronnie Princes Apple MagSafe device went into thermal runaway. The SkyWest flight attendant responded to the fire with the halon fire extinguisher. The flight landed and the fire department responded to the aircraft. Passenger was treated for burn to hands and transported to the hospital via Life Flight. The device is reported to be an Apple MagSafe battery pack, passenger took the device with him and will not talk to SkyWest or United Airlines.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received call over radio about leaking hazmat at WA357. Put on gloves, took bin and absorbent mats with me, placed wet package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing DescribePack: Inspection revealed a small hole in the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Put on gloves, quickly placed package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped the box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing, ran hands under cold water for an extended period of time just in case.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package picked up from the unload. Upon inspection, the damaged products contained an undeclared hazmat. The package was damaged out by another station and returned to sender. A SDS was obtained for the damaged product. The other four containers were not damaged. The damaged product had a loose cap and leakage amounting to 1.057X4 Gallons. The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. Proper paperwork was filed and that hazmat was brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: There was a loose cap and leakage from Detail King Bug Off. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. The hazmat was then placed in the hazmat cage.

Using proper PPE gear to assess the hazmat we found that the lid to one of the glass bottles of tetrahydrofuran had a loose cap which caused the liquid to leak out. DescribePack: Package failed due to the cap of one of the bottles of tetrahydrofuran being loose and leaking out only causing damage to itself. There are no holes in the box due to the spill. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Quickly removed the damaged hazmat before anymore of the liquid could leak out and cause any damage to other packages.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the tops of two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to loose bung caps. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the bung caps and wiped down the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The two (2) 55-gallon poly drums were then shipped onto the consignee. The spent rags used from the clean-up were containerized into one 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080560
item.description:
Report E-2023080560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: Concordia
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BASIC CHEMICAL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 07:30 on Monday, July 31, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering 31.25 Sodium Chlorite to a customer site (City of Concordia Water Treatment Plant) located in Concordia, MO. The driver positioned the tanker in the offload area, connected to the customer's piping system, and started the flow of product. The driver quickly walked inside the building where the customer tank is located to check the status of the tank and then walked back out of the building to monitor the offload process. Upon exiting the building the driver noticed that the customer's connection point had failed (PVC cam-lock fitting broke free from tank piping) and approximately 5-gallons of product had been spilled to the ground. The driver quickly shut down the offloading operation and notified customer site personnel who immediately contained and cleaned up the spill. No injuries or property damage occurred as a result of this spill.

item.title: Report E-2023080509
item.description:
Report E-2023080509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: PORTSMOUTH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: APEX LOGISTICS INTERNATIONAL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESCRIPTION: A 40ft ocean container caught fire while in transit storage prior to loading at the CSX ramp in Norfolk, Virginia. The fire was caused by undeclared and improperly packaged Lithium Ion Batteries (EV Vehicle Batteries). The container was loaded at a facility in St Louis, Missouri, chosen by the shipper. However, the shipping documents provided by the shipper to Apex Logistics, declared the commodity as "Copper Flakes" and not dangerous goods. RESPONSE: Upon notification of the fire, Apex Logistics International LLC informed the steamship line CMA CGM that there could be undeclared dangerous goods in all the containers from this shipper. 24 containers from this shipper were in Norfolk, VA. INVESTIGATION: A surveyor has inspected the containers, and out of the 24 containers, all 24 of them have been identified to contain some form of dangerous goods, specifically batteries either class 9 or class 8. Some of the containers, contained D/D/R Lithium Batteries that were correctly packed according to the 49 CFR, however at least 4 containers contained unpacked Recycled Lithium Batteries (EV Batteries). CORRECTIVE ACTIONS: Due to the severity and complexity of the incident, the shipper, Zhiyun Sports LLC, has authorized Apex Logistics International LLC to arrange the pickup, storage, and return of the containers. Apex Logistics has contracted a hazardous materials emergency service (Hepaco) to assist in the offloading and safe storage of these dangerous goods.

We got permission to break the seal and tighten it properly and then had the takwash clean off the exterior before proceeding.

item.title: Report X-2023080692
item.description:
Report X-2023080692

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080692 SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING LOADED ONTO THE VAN TO BE DELIVERED BACK TO THE SHIPPER AND WHEN DOING SO THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS NOT SECURE AND ONE OF THE JUGS SLIPPED OUT AND BROKE. THERE WAS NOT ENOUGH TAPE ON THE BOX TO KEEP THE CONTENTS SECURE. BOX OPENED. AREA WAS CLEARED WHILE THE CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP, PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND MOVED TO BE PROCESSED. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF BOX NOT SECURLY TAPED. BOX OPENED DURING A PACKAGE HANDLER LOADING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: DRY CONTENTS TO ABSORB THE LIQUID WAS PLACED ON THE WET SPOTS TILL IT WAS UP OFF THE FLOOR. PACKAGE HANDLER WAS REMOVED FROM THE AREA TILL ALL CLEAN. 2. X-2023080744 SequenceEvent: ITEM WAS DISCOVERED BY THE STATIONS TRASH CANS AND DAMAGE AREA. IT WAS IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM IN HAZMAT BAGS. BROKEN CONTENTS AND CLEAN UP MATERIALS. UNSURE ON HOW THE DAMAGE BOTTLES HAPPENED OR WHEN THIS OCCURED. PKG WAS THEN PROCESSED AS A DAMAGE. DescribePack: UNSURE ON HOW THE PACKAGE FAILURE OCCURED OR WHAT FAILED EXACTLY. THE BOTTLES WERE BUSTED SO I ASSUME THEY WERE DROPPED AND BROKE THAT WAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS REVIEWED AND SECURED FOR PROPER PROCESSING AND FOLLOW UP.
